receivedAmount.description: The on-chain amount according to the latest `received` block.

txnHash.description: Deposits that are found on-chain will have a `txn_hash` and `txn_index`. If it is a pending deposit determined by some external payment system, these can be empty

createdAt.description: When we first started tracking this deposit. Probably in the mempool.

updatedAt.description: If `txn_state` is `Confirmed` and `KytStatus` is accepted, this is the time that the deposit is credited. Otherwise, it is the last update (e.g if a kyt external id was created, or transaction state updated).

txnState.description: The deposit is credited when `Confirmed` and accepted.

timeEst.description: The estimated time that this deposit will transition to `Confirmed`. This is currently only applicable for `Received` deposits

txnHash.description: Once the transaction has been determined / sent, `txn_hash`, `txn_index`, and `txn_state` will be populated

updatedAt.description: When the withdrawal was sent out.

attemptId.description: A unique identifier for this withdrawal request.

parameters.name: createdBefore
parameters.description: Returns the most recent orders where `created_at < created_before`. If null, returns the most recent orders.

schema.description: Returns the most recent orders where `created_at < created_before`. If null, returns the most recent orders.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of orders to return. If null, defaults to 100. The maximum is 1000.

schema.description: The maximum number of orders to return. If null, defaults to 100. The maximum is 1000.

orderId.description: The cube-assigned order ID, also known as `ExchangeOrderId`. Unique per order.

createdAt.description: The matching-engine transact-time in nanoseconds that this order was created.

modifiedAt.description: The matching-engine transact-time in nanoseconds of the most recent modify event. Empty if the order was never modified.

canceledAt.description: The matching-engine transact-time in nanoseconds when this order was cancelled. Empty if the order was never cancelled, e.g. is open or filled.

modifies.description: Any previous states of price/quantity associated with this order due to modifies. If the order has been modified, the original price/quantity will appear in this list.

reason.description: Reject reason if rejected. Cancel reason if canceled.

settled.description:
The settlement status for this order's fills.

If the order has no fills, or none of the fills have been assigned to a settlement batch, then this will be `None`. This can be derived from `fills`.

status.description: The current status of this order. Note that if the order is `Open`, this is a best-effort estimation, and the order service has the most correct status.

orderFees.description: Any fees applied to the order as a whole, which are distinct from any fees applied to each fill.

assetId.description: The asset to withdraw. The network is determined by the asset ID.

amount.description: The amount to withdraw. This is denominated in the smallest unit of the asset (e.g. satoshis for BTC, wei for ETH, lamports for SOL). The amount must be greater than the dust limit for the asset.

destination.description: The destination address for the withdrawal.

signature.description: Base-64 encoded signature of this withdrawal request

status.description: The status of the external KYT check

approved.description: Whether the withdrawal was approved by the system

reason.description: The reason for the withdrawal being rejected

500.description: An error occurred while processing the request

get.description:
Statistics about the price of an asset during a specific time interval.
Fields are: [
    time (in seconds since epoch),
    open price,
    high price,
    low price,
    close price,
    volume (in RawUnits)
]

500.description: An error occurred while processing the request

get.summary: Fetch all asset, market, and source definitions

symbol.description: The canonical symbol for this asset.

decimals.description:
The maximum precision of this asset.

e.g `18` for ETH (`10^18` WEI per ETH), `8` for BTC (`10^8` SAT per BTC)

displayDecimals.description: The default number of decimal places to display for human-readable quantities for this asset.

settles.description: Whether this asset settles to the blockchain.

sourceId.description: The source ID of this asset.

items.description:
A collection of assets grouped by origination.

For `Crypto` assets, this is their native blockchain.

e.g `ETH` and `SHIB` are both on the `ethereum` (`CHAIN_ID = 0x1`) blockchain.

name.description: A human-readable name for this source.

transactionExplorer.description:
The URL of a block explorer that can be used to view transactions.

The value is provided as a format string with a single `{}` placeholder for the transaction. e.g `https://etherscan.io/tx/{}`

addressExplorer.description:
The URL of a block explorer that can be used to view addresses.

The value is provided as a format string with a single `{}` placeholder for the address. e.g `https://etherscan.io/address/{}`

items.description: A market is identified by its unique `marketId`. The market definition specifies specifies the base and quote assets and their respective lot sizes for the particular market.

symbol.description:
The market's symbol. Normally this is base symbol concatenated with the quote symbol.

e.g `BTCUSDC`

baseAssetId.description: The asset ID of the base asset.

baseLotSize.description: The number of units of the base asset that are represented by one base lot.

quoteAssetId.description: The asset ID of the quote asset.

quoteLotSize.description: The number of units of the quote asset that are represented by one quote lot.

priceDisplayDecimals.description: The default number of decimal places to display for human-readable prices for this market.

priceBandBidPct.description: The percentage that a new bid can be placed below the current reference price.

priceBandAskPct.description: The percentage that a new ask can be placed above the current reference price.

minOrderQty.description: The minimum order quantity lots for this market. Inclusive.

maxOrderQty.description: The maximum order quantity lots for this market. Inclusive.

feeTableId.description: ID of the fee table that will be used for lookups on this market.

baseMarketIds.description: If this is an implied market, this is the list of implied-through base markets. Otherwise, this is `None`.

isImplied.description: If this market is currently enabled for implied matching, this will be `true`. Otherwise, this will be `false` or missing.

items.description: A fee table consisting of one or more fee tiers. Each tier is applied in priority order and the first tier whose requirements match the characteristics of a given fill determines the fees for that fill. Each market is associated with a specific fee table via its "feeTableId".
A single row in a FeeTable.

priority.description: The order in which this tier is considered when applying the fee table that contains it.

makerFeeRatio.description: The multiplicative fee ratio for the resting order

takerFeeRatio.description: The multiplicative fee ratio for the aggressing order

500.description: An error occurred while processing the request

ApiKey.name: x-api-key
ApiKey.description:
The API Key ID as specified in the [API settings page](https://cube.exchange/settings/api).

Each API key has a corresponding access level that is set when the key is created.
- Read access only allows access to read HTTP methods (GET, HEAD, etc.).
- Write access allows access to all HTTP methods.

ApiSignature.name: x-api-signature
ApiSignature.description:
The API signature string authenticating this request.

The payload to be signed is the concatenation of the byte string `cube.xyz` and the current unix epoch timestamp in seconds converted into an 8-byte little-endian array. The signature is the HMAC-SHA256 digest of the payload using the secret key associated with the specified API key.

Implementation notes:
- The signature is base-64 encoded with the 'standard' alphabet and
  padding.

  ```
  ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZabcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz0123456789+/
  ```
- The timestamp should be encoded as 8-byte little-endian (array of bytes)
- The secret key should be decoded from a hex string into a 32-byte array of
  bytes

ApiTimestamp.name: x-api-timestamp
ApiTimestamp.description: The timestamp used for signature generation.

x-cube-request-id.description: The cube-assigned ID for this request. If known, please supply with support requests
